translated: All and so forth: it is the consecration of the mandala emanated by the samadhi of all Tathagatas, and so forth, because it makes one a vessel for the bestowal of consecration. It is the consecration of the mandala of the samadhi of all Tathagatas.

original: de nyid gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams la 'gebs pa dang chos mthun pas le'u'o //
analyzed: de nyid gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams la 'gebs pa dang chos mthun pas le'u'o //
translated: It is a chapter because it is a protection for the beings to be tamed, similar to a covering.

original: brjod par bya ba de nyid du len pas zhes bya ba ni le'u ste gzhung yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de nyid du len pas zhes bya ba ni le'u ste gzhung yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: The to be expressed is taken as the very chapter, because it is the section of the text.

original: dang po ni thog mar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni thog mar bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the first teaching.

original: rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las /
analyzed: rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar zhes bya ba'i don to // dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dka' 'grel rgyal bas byin pas mdzad pa las /
translated: The phrase is completed means is well grasped.

original: le'u dang po'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the first chapter of the glorious Guhyasamaja composed by Jayabhadra.

original: // / rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams ni 'bras bu don du gnyer bas 'jug ste /
analyzed: // / rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams ni 'bras bu don du gnyer bas 'jug ste /
translated: Those who are realized engage in the practice because they seek the result.

original: dang po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das nges par bstan nas /üîΩde nyid sku la sogs par mngon par zhen pa bsal bas shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das nges par bstan nas / de nyid sku la sogs par mngon par zhen pa bsal bas shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u gsungs pa /
translated: First, the Bhagavan taught the result endowed with the supreme of all aspects.

original: de nas @168a * //
analyzed: de nas @168a * //
translated: Then, in order to clarify the nature of wisdom by dispelling clinging to that very [result] as being a body and so forth, the chapter on bodhicitta is taught.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo snod du byas pa la sogs pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo snod du byas pa la sogs pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: There, then is the immediate sequence of making the disciples suitable vessels and so forth.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis brtan pa'i phyir snying po'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis brtan pa'i phyir snying po'o //
translated: It is the essence because it is firm by nature as the realm of phenomena, which is without beginning or end.

original: sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: It is the body, speech, and mind because it is the nature of the emanation body and so forth.

original: ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog gam 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog gam 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme because it is the nature of the body of wisdom, or because it is the support of all beings.

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it not also the case that this is not the domain of the bodhisattvas?

original: gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes so //
translated: It is said that it is the domain of all the tathagatas.

original: gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ba'o //
translated: It is secret because it is not the domain of others.

original: 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: It is the thought of awakening.üîΩIt is indestructible, nonconceptual,

original: mi 'jig rnam par mi sems dang // brjod bya ma yin rnam rtog min //
analyzed: mi 'jig rnam par mi sems dang // brjod bya ma yin rnam rtog min //
translated: inexpressible, and nonconceptual.

original: dge ba'i chos kyi sems kyi phyir //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi sems kyi phyir //
translated: Because it is the thought of the virtuous Dharma,

original: byang chub sems ni ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni ye shes so //
translated: the thought of awakening is wisdom.

original: gang yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: thog ma tha ma med zhi ba //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med zhi ba //
translated: It is without beginning or end, peaceful,

original: dngos dang dngos med zad pa'i gtso //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med zad pa'i gtso //
translated: The chief of the exhaustion of things and non-things.

original: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
translated: The indivisibility of emptiness and compassion

original: byang chub sems zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: Is explained as the thought of awakening.

original: ces so // thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: Because it is the best of all, it is unsurpassed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i rjes la mkhyen cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i rjes la mkhyen cing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: After the request of all the Tathagatas, he says, ‚Äúknowing,‚Äù etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don du bdag la 'di rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa yin gyi rang gi don du ni ma yin zhes bshad nas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don du bdag la 'di rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa yin gyi rang gi don du ni ma yin zhes bshad nas te /
translated: He explains that the request is for the sake of the Bodhisattvas, not for his own sake.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / yongs su ma shes pa dang / mngon du ma byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / yongs su ma shes pa dang / mngon du ma byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The philosophy is that there is nothing that the Tathagatas have not seen, have not heard, have not known, have not actualized.

original: sems kyis yongs su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs pa dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / ji ltar sku la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs pa dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / ji ltar sku la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase fully realized by the mind refers to the thusness of all phenomena, which is free from objectification. The phrase how can they become a body, etc.? refers to the mental expression.

original: sems nyid mi gsal ba'i phyir rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid mi gsal ba'i phyir rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the ear consciousness, etc., because the mind itself is not clear.

original: de rnams la zhes pa ni gang rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa la'o //
analyzed: de rnams la zhes pa ni gang rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa la'o //
translated: The phrase to them refers to those for whom the Tathagatas make the request.

original: bskyed par bya ba de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus 'di gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid @168b kyi gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba de
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba de gang yin zhe na gsungs pa sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus 'di gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid @168b kyi gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba de
translated: What is to be generated? It is stated: The mind like a body. Just as this body is empty by nature, free from being one or many, etc., and free from the nature of being an object, etc.,

original: bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa rnam pa med pa'i rang gis sems bskyed cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa rnam pa med pa'i rang gis sems bskyed cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: in the same way, generate the mind that is free from aspects, which engages in a nondual manner.

original: lus sems lta bu zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyi rdzas la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir lus dang sems kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: lus sems lta bu zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyi rdzas la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir lus dang sems kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch things as body and mind‚Äù refers to the nature of body and mind, because the substances of the parts and so on do not exist in reality.

original: zhes khyed kyis nges par gzung bar bya ste sems las gzhan lus med do zhes rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes khyed kyis nges par gzung bar bya ste sems las gzhan lus med do zhes rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: You should understand that there is no body apart from mind.

original: de ltar lus dang sems dag mnyam pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems dag mnyam pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the sameness of body and mind,üîΩhe states the sameness of those two with speech:

original: de dag nyid ngag dang mnyam par gsungs pa sems tshig don du brjod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid ngag dang mnyam par gsungs pa sems tshig don du brjod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMind is like speech in the expression of meaning.‚Äù

original: ji ltar tshig tu brjod pa ni ngag 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshig tu brjod pa ni ngag 'jug pa ste /
translated: Just as speech is the expression in words,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: it is dependently arisen and is essentially unborn from the beginning.

original: de ltar sems kyang rgyu dang 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu rang gi rig pa tsam du 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar sems kyang rgyu dang 'bras bus stong pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu rang gi rig pa tsam du 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, mind is always engaged in mere self-awareness, because it is empty of cause and effect.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: This is also stated:

original: dngos po rang las ma skyes dang // gzhan las ma skyes gnyis las min //
analyzed: dngos po rang las ma skyes dang // gzhan las ma skyes gnyis las min //
translated: Not produced from itself, not produced from another, not produced from both,üîΩnot without cause,

original: yod min med min gnyis ka min //
analyzed: yod min med min gnyis ka min //
translated: not existent, not non-existent, not both,

original: de ni gang las skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni gang las skye bar 'gyur //
translated: from what, pray tell, is it produced?

original: zhes so // yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // yang gsungs pa /
translated: And again it is said:

original: rtag tu rten cing 'brel 'byung phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu rten cing 'brel 'byung phyir //
translated: Because it is always dependently arisen,

original: rang bzhin 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
translated: it is difficult to transcend its nature.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir dag dang lus kyang mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bya ste lus dang sems rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir dag dang lus kyang mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bya ste lus dang sems rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the body and the mind are the same, because the body and mind are not different in nature.

original: 'dis 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught by this:

original: chad pa la sogs pa'i lta ba bsal nas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du chos bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: chad pa la sogs pa'i lta ba bsal nas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du chos bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: Having eliminated the views of nihilism and so forth, one should see the identity of the body and so forth, by the identity of the selflessness of phenomena, just as it is taught.

original: yang na khyed kyis sems skyed cing ces spyir bya ba la sbyor ba'o//
analyzed: yang na khyed kyis sems skyed cing ces spyir bya ba la sbyor ba'o//
translated: Or, you should generate the mind, and so forth, is a general application to the action.

original: bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The action is taught:

original: lus lta bu ni lus zhes te /
analyzed: lus lta bu ni lus zhes te /
translated: The body is like the body.

original: rnam par dpyad na rang rig pa tsam las ma gtogs pa gzhan lus kyi rnam pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na rang rig pa tsam las ma gtogs pa gzhan lus kyi rnam pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When analyzed, there is not even the slightest form of a body apart from mere self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa tsam de nyid du lus la ltos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam de nyid du lus la ltos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that mere self-awareness itself is dependent on the body.

original: sems ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: sems ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How should the mind be viewed? It is stated:

original: sems sems lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan sems nye bar dmigs pa med pa dang / snang ba yang rtog pa las skyes pas de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir //üîΩsems kyang rtog pa @169a * //
analyzed: sems sems lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan sems nye bar dmigs pa med pa dang / snang ba yang rtog pa las skyes pas de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir // sems kyang rtog pa @169a * //
translated: The mind is like the mind. Apart from the appearance of blue and so forth, no other mind is observed. And since the appearance is also arisen from conceptuality, it is not its own nature.üîΩThe mind is also empty of all conceptual stains.

original: thams cad kyi dri mas stong pa nyid kyis rang rig pa mthar phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dri mas stong pa nyid kyis rang rig pa mthar phyin pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate is self-awareness.

original: tshig tu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is called ‚Äúverbal expression‚Äù

original: lus dang sems rang gi ngo bo sgra brnyan gyi sgra dang mnyam pa nyid du skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang sems rang gi ngo bo sgra brnyan gyi sgra dang mnyam pa nyid du skyed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the nature of body and mind should be generated as being the same as the sound of an echo.

original: 'dis ni tshig kyang bdag med par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig kyang bdag med par gsungs te /
translated: This also teaches that words are selfless,

original: lus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of being non-different from the body, etc.

original: kha cig las ngag tshig tu brjod pa zhes brjod pa'i tshig de la ngag kyang sgra brnyan dang 'dra bar sgra dngos po med par rtogs shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig las ngag tshig tu brjod pa zhes brjod pa'i tshig de la ngag kyang sgra brnyan dang 'dra bar sgra dngos po med par rtogs shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In some [texts], it is said that speech is the expression of words. The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúRealize that speech, like an echo, is a sound that is not a thing‚Äù is that the words expressed are also selfless.

original: de bzhin du bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa //
translated: Similarly, the thirteenth chapter states:

original: sku yi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: sku yi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
translated: The perfect enlightenment of the vajra body

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam dpyad pa //
translated: is the analysis of things and non-things.

original: gsung gi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
translated: The perfect enlightenment of the vajra speech

original: sgra dang sgra min rnam dpyad pa //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra min rnam dpyad pa //
translated: is the analysis of sound and non-sound.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
translated: The perfect enlightenment of the vajra mind

original: gnas pa'i rdo rje rnam dpyad pa //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rdo rje rnam dpyad pa //
translated: is the analysis of the abiding vajra.

original: zhes so // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di'i rtog pa bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di'i rtog pa bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: The bodhisattvas teach the accomplishment of the realizations of this [vajra yoga]:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn, the Vajra Body,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kyi rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa nam mkha' lta bur sbyar nas rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs pas ched du brjod pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnams kyi rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa nam mkha' lta bur sbyar nas rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs pas ched du brjod pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Having applied those bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas to the nature of Vajradhara, the sky-like body and so forth of all tathƒÅgatas, through realizing the lack of intrinsic nature, he uttered this purposeful statement:

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and so forth,

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnam par dag pa ston pa po'i don dam pa nyid du de bzhin nyid gcig gi ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnam par dag pa ston pa po'i don dam pa nyid du de bzhin nyid gcig gi ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'o //
translated: the so-called Samantabhadra is the ultimate itself, which teaches the purity of conduct in desire and so forth, being unborn by the nature of the single essence of thusness.

original: kun rdzob tu gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis rmi lam bzhin du 'dir skye bar bsgrags te bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gdul bya'i skye bo'i dbang gis rmi lam bzhin du 'dir skye bar bsgrags te bstan to //
translated: Conventionally, for the sake of disciples, it is proclaimed and taught as if born here, like a dream.

original: gang skye ba med pa las tha mi dad pa nyid skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa las tha mi dad pa nyid skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: The so-called unborn is a wonder, being non-different from the unborn.

original: da ni 'di gang rigs ma nges pa'i dbang du byas na spyi'i byang chub kyi sems 'di gsungs la /
analyzed: da ni 'di gang rigs ma nges pa'i dbang du byas na spyi'i byang chub kyi sems 'di gsungs la /
translated: Now, in terms of the indeterminate, this is taught in general as the thought of awakening.

original: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i rigs nges pa'i ched du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dbye ba drug bstan te rang gi ngo bo la ni dbye ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i rigs nges pa'i ched du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dbye ba drug bstan te rang gi ngo bo la ni dbye ba med do //
translated: For the sake of the future definite lineage, the six divisions of Vajrasattva and so forth are taught, but there is no division in its own nature.

original: gang yang gsungs pa /üîΩsangs rgyas sangs rgyas thams cad las //
analyzed: gang yang gsungs pa / sangs rgyas sangs rgyas thams cad las //
translated: Also, it is said:üîΩThis is the self-arisen BhagavƒÅn,

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: the one Buddha from all Buddhas.

original: gcig pu de ni lhag pa'i lha //
analyzed: gcig pu de ni lhag pa'i lha //
translated: He alone is the supreme deity,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
translated: the Buddha, Vajradhara, and so forth.

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis mdzad pa dran //
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang gis mdzad pa dran //
translated: Due to the power of those to be tamed, the deeds are remembered.

original: zhes so // de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa @169b thams cad kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje 'chang gi byang chub kyi sems nye bar dgod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa @169b thams cad kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje 'chang gi byang chub kyi sems nye bar dgod pa gsungs pa /
translated: To that end, since it is the nature of the pristine consciousness of all tathƒÅgatas, the introduction of the thought of awakening of glorious Vajradhara is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par byang chub pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'o //
translated: Then, etc. The manifest enlightenment of all the Tathagatas is the five intuitions, such as the pure, etc.

original: de'i tshul ni thabs te rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i tshul ni thabs te rdo rje 'chang gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The manner of that is the means, the samadhi of Vajradhara.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pa ni rdo rje 'chang la dmigs pa sems rtse gcig tu mdzad nas de nas byang chub kyi sems gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pa ni rdo rje 'chang la dmigs pa sems rtse gcig tu mdzad nas de nas byang chub kyi sems gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the vajra, the indivisible samadhi, in which he entered, i.e., he made his mind one-pointed, focused on Vajradhara, and then he spoke the thought of enlightenment.

original: dngos po med la sgom pa med //
analyzed: dngos po med la sgom pa med //
translated: There is no meditation on the inexistent.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dngos po gang la don zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la don zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste /
translated: The thing is called the object.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind in the form of duality is the thing.

original: dngos po de med pas na dngos med de gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa'i sems so //
analyzed: dngos po de med pas na dngos med de gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa'i sems so //
translated: The non-existence of that thing is the inexistent, the mind in the form of non-duality.

original: de la med pa yin te rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i ye shes la'o //
analyzed: de la med pa yin te rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i ye shes la'o //
translated: There is no meditation on that, i.e., in the intuition free from the stain of all conceptual constructions.

original: sgom pa ni gang zhig rdo rje 'chang snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sgom pa ni gang zhig rdo rje 'chang snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Meditation is the characteristic of the appearance of Vajradhara.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa med pa ste /
translated: Because of the non-existence of the ultimate,

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i don du so sor snang ba'i dngos por rdo rje 'chang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i don du so sor snang ba'i dngos por rdo rje 'chang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: therefore, for the sake of the world, the form of Vajradhara and so forth appears as an entity.

original: don dam par skye ba med pa nyid kyis dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med pa nyid kyis dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no arising ultimately, there is non-existence.

original: des na dngos po ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, an entity does not become a non-entity.

original: 'dis bzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bas na gang de bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis bzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral bas na gang de bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is free from the aspects of grasping and so forth is what is to be meditated upon.

original: de yang sgom pa dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sgom pa dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, meditation is not an object of perception.

original: rang rig pa tsam gyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam gyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the reality of mere self-awareness, that is the meaning.

original: yang gsungs pa /üîΩgang la sgom byed cung zad med //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / gang la sgom byed cung zad med //
translated: Again it is said:üîΩThere is not the slightest meditation.

original: bsgom pa cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: bsgom pa cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: There is not the slightest meditator.

original: bsgom par bya ba nyid kyang med //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba nyid kyang med //
translated: There is not the slightest object of meditation.

original: de ni 'di nyid bsgom par brjod //
analyzed: de ni 'di nyid bsgom par brjod //
translated: That is said to be the meditation on this.

original: ces bya'o // yang na dngos po rnams la tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi dngos pa med pa nyid la gang bsgom pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces pa de'i mngon par zhen pa de'i ngo bo yod pa de /
analyzed: ces bya'o // yang na dngos po rnams la tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyi dngos pa med pa nyid la gang bsgom pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces pa de'i mngon par zhen pa de'i ngo bo yod pa de /
translated: Or else, the non-existence of things that is harmed by valid cognitions in regard to things is cultivated, and the nature of the entity that is the manifest clinging to that is all phenomena are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po zhes nges par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po zhes nges par bzung ba'o //
translated: That is ascertained as the entity of emptiness.

original: der lan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: der lan yang gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to that is also stated:

original: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
translated: Cultivation itself is not cultivation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: gang yang dngos po stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin bsgom par brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir rang @170a * //
analyzed: gang yang dngos po stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin bsgom par brjod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir rang @170a * //
translated: Also, if it is said that the nature of the cultivation of the emptiness of things is expressed, that is also not reasonable.

original: nyid dngos po med pa yin na gang las de'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid dngos po med pa yin na gang las de'i stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Because if it is itself non-existent, from what would its emptiness arise?

original: chos can yod pa las chos su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: chos can yod pa las chos su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las /
translated: From the reasoning that states, ‚ÄúThe quality arises from the existent quality-bearer,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: therefore is the summary.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de'i phyir dngos po dngos por mi 'gyur te de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar de'i phyir dngos po dngos por mi 'gyur te de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, a thing does not become a thing, and therefore a thing and a non-thing do not occur.

original: de yang gsungs pa /üîΩstong pa nyid du bsgom bya min //
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa / stong pa nyid du bsgom bya min //
translated: And that is stated:üîΩEmptiness should not be cultivated.

original: mi stong pa yang bsgom bya min //
analyzed: mi stong pa yang bsgom bya min //
translated: Nor should the non-empty be cultivated.

original: stong nyid mi spong rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: stong nyid mi spong rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ should not abandon emptiness.

original: mi stong pa yang spang mi bya //
analyzed: mi stong pa yang spang mi bya //
translated: Nor should the non-empty be abandoned.

original: stong dang mi stong gang 'dzin pa //
analyzed: stong dang mi stong gang 'dzin pa //
translated: Whoever grasps emptiness or non-emptiness

original: brjod kyis mi lang rtog pa skye //
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang rtog pa skye //
translated: Generates inexpressible conceptualization.

original: rtog pa yongs su spangs pas na //
analyzed: rtog pa yongs su spangs pas na //
translated: Since conceptualization is completely abandoned,

original: de phyir 'di la gnyis ni spangs //
analyzed: de phyir 'di la gnyis ni spangs //
translated: Therefore, duality is abandoned here.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa yang med do zhes bya bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa yang med do zhes bya bar gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is stated that the object of meditation and meditation itself do not exist.

original: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Meditation is not an object of observation.

original: zhes so // gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / dngos po'i dngos po med pa bsgom par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sgom pa yang med do //
analyzed: zhes so // gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / dngos po'i dngos po med pa bsgom par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sgom pa yang med do //
translated: Because a thing, a non-thing, and the non-thing that is a thing are not objects of meditation, therefore meditation does not exist.

original: 'dis ni dngos po thams cad nye bar dmigs pa gsal bar bshad pas smon par bya ba dang / smon par byed pa dang / smon lam mi dmigs pas bar chod pa'i 'bras bu bkag pas rang gi sems nyid mngon par byang chub pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po thams cad nye bar dmigs pa gsal bar bshad pas smon par bya ba dang / smon par byed pa dang / smon lam mi dmigs pas bar chod pa'i 'bras bu bkag pas rang gi sems nyid mngon par byang chub pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This explains the clear observation of all things, and by the negation of the result of the interruption of the non-observation of the object of aspiration, the agent of aspiration, and the aspiration itself, it teaches that the mind itself is the manifest enlightenment.

original: de yang gsungs pa /üîΩsems nyid dngos grub chen po ste //
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa / sems nyid dngos grub chen po ste //
translated: And that is stated:üîΩThe mind itself is the great success,

original: sems nyid thub pa chen po yin //
analyzed: sems nyid thub pa chen po yin //
translated: The mind itself is the great sage,

original: sems nyid yid bzhin nor bur brjod //
analyzed: sems nyid yid bzhin nor bur brjod //
translated: The mind itself is called the wish-fulfilling gem,

original: sems nyid bde ba chen po yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems nyid bde ba chen po yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mind itself is great bliss.

original: yang na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dmigs su med pas na bsgom par bya ba yod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dmigs su med pas na bsgom par bya ba yod pa med pa ste /
translated: Or else, since all things are not observed in any way, there is no existence of the object of meditation.

original: chos can la brten nas chos gnas pa'o //üîΩgang yang rtog pas sbyar ba'i dngos po yang bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can la brten nas chos gnas pa'o // gang yang rtog pas sbyar ba'i dngos po yang bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma abides in dependence on the substratum.üîΩAlso, the thing that is connected by imagination is not the meditation,

original: de yang de kho na nyid ma yin pa la brten nas bsgom pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid ma yin pa la brten nas bsgom pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that is not the meditation in dependence on what is not reality.

original: de'i phyir dngos po nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de thams cad stong pa nyid kyi phyir med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de thams cad stong pa nyid kyi phyir med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since that very entity, which is the characteristic of the pristine consciousness of nonduality, is empty of everything, it does not exist.

original: 'di'i yang rang bzhin du grub pa'i phyir sgom pa tha dad pa dmigs su med pa gang gis de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yang rang bzhin du grub pa'i phyir sgom pa tha dad pa dmigs su med pa gang gis de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it is also established as the nature, the meditation is not observed to be different.

original: de yang gsungs pa thams cad gsang ba las /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa thams cad gsang ba las /
translated: That is also stated in the Tantra of the Secret of All:

original: dngos po min pa bsgom @170b pa min //
analyzed: dngos po min pa bsgom @170b pa min //
translated: It is not a meditation on nonentity.

original: sgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
analyzed: sgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
translated: Meditation itself is not meditation.

original: sgom pa dang ni dngos po med //
analyzed: sgom pa dang ni dngos po med //
translated: Meditation and nonentity

original: rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags //
translated: are imagined by one‚Äôs mind.

original: zhes so // sku la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyi sems nye bar dgod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // sku la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub kyi sems nye bar dgod par gsungs pa /
translated: The introduction of the bodhicitta of Vairocana through the nature of the nonarising essence of the kƒÅya, and so on, is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, the introduction of the bodhicitta of Vairocana is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: The realization of all tathƒÅgatas is the mirror-like pristine consciousness.

original: 'dis shes par bya ba de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs par byed pa ni shes par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dis shes par bya ba de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs par byed pa ni shes par byed pas so //
translated: It is the illuminator because it causes the realization of reality, which is to be known, just as it is.

original: de nyid rdo rje zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje zhes bya ste /
translated: That itself is called the vajra.

original: gang la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gang la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with that which was spoken by entering into the meditative concentration having the aspect of Vairocana.

original: dngos po thams cad ni bdag la sogs par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni bdag la sogs par brtags pa ste /
translated: All things are imagined as self and so forth.

original: de rnams la tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir de dang 'brel te //
analyzed: de rnams la tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir de dang 'brel te //
translated: They are connected with that because they are harmed by valid cognition.

original: 'o na ni phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then they would be the nature of the aggregates and so forth.

original: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The aggregates and so forth are the five such as form.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad do //
translated: The eighteen constituents are by the division of the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas skye mched bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas skye mched bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve sense bases are by the division of the faculties and objects.

original: gzung ba ni yul lo //
analyzed: gzung ba ni yul lo //
translated: The apprehended is the object.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The apprehender is consciousness.

original: de rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis stong pa'i phyir phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Because they are empty of those, they are free from the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and the duality of object and subject.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid pas zhes te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid pas zhes te /
translated: Because of the sameness of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos rnams ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena are the aggregates and so forth.

original: bdag med pa ni rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Selflessness is the absence of intrinsic nature when analyzed.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang mnyam pa nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo'i sems rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang mnyam pa nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo'i sems rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: That is the nature of sameness, the nature of the mind that is the cause of everything.

original: rang gi sems ni mthar phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni mthar phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: One's own mind is the nature of perfection.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu stong pa nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu stong pa nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the dependent nature, which is the emptiness of cause and effect.

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: It is primordially unborn.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the nature of the emptiness of the imagined nature.

original: yang na dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang las byung ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang las byung ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: Or, being free from all things means the things that arise from the power of ignorance.

original: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: It is imagined to have a variety of natures.

original: da dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad dang bral ba de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //üîΩde ltar na phung po la @171a * //
analyzed: da dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad dang bral ba de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so // de ltar na phung po la @171a * //
translated: Since it is free from that, it is free from all things. That is nondual wisdom.

original: sogs pa rnam par dag pas grub pa yin na ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa rnam par dag pas grub pa yin na ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Thus, if it is established by the purity of the aggregates and so on, how can it be a buddha and a bodhisattva?

original: gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid don dam par med pas so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid don dam par med pas so //
translated: The nature of the aggregates and so on is the nonexistence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject of buddhas and bodhisattvas ultimately.

original: des na chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid pas //
analyzed: des na chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid pas //
translated: Therefore, since the selflessness of phenomena is sameness,

original: rang gi sems thog ma nas skye ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: rang gi sems thog ma nas skye ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: one's mind is primordially unborn, the nature of emptiness.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba'o //
translated: This appears with the nature of the tathƒÅgatas and so on.

original: ci ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i gang zag gzhan gyi ngo bor yod pa de ni bdag cag la sogs pas re zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i gang zag gzhan gyi ngo bor yod pa de ni bdag cag la sogs pas re zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it exists as the nature of a person who is free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject, then it is not realized by us through direct perception.

original: gzhan du na de kho na nyid mthong bas grol bar thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na de kho na nyid mthong bas grol bar thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one would be liberated by seeing reality.

original: 'bras bus kyang mig la sogs pa bzhin dpog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bus kyang mig la sogs pa bzhin dpog pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it inferred from the effect, like the eye and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir gnyis kyis rnam par snang ba yang /üîΩri bong gi rva dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no zhe na skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir gnyis kyis rnam par snang ba yang / ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no zhe na skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because nondual wisdom has no effect, and the appearance as dualityüîΩis not a thing, like the horn of an ass.

original: 'dzin pa bkag nas nang gi rtog pa'i ngo bo ma bkag ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa bkag nas nang gi rtog pa'i ngo bo ma bkag ste /
translated: There is no fault, because while apprehending is refuted, the nature of inner thought is not refuted.

original: 'di ltar gang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa lta bu sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa de rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa lta bu sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa de rnam par dpyad mi bzod pas yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Thus, like something different from consciousness, the thought of blue and so on cannot withstand analysis and so does not have the nature of existence.

original: des na rnam par shes pa las gzung ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de la ltos pa'i yang rtog pa'i ngo bo byed pa po yang med de /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa las gzung ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de la ltos pa'i yang rtog pa'i ngo bo byed pa po yang med de /
translated: Therefore, since the object does not exist apart from consciousness, the agent, the nature of imagination, does not exist in dependence on it.

original: byed pa po dang las phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtog pa'i ngo bo ni phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i ngo bo ni phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid de bzhin du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid de bzhin du skyes pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi ngo po rang rig pa tsam du rnam par gnas te ji skad du brjod pa gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa brjod par bya ste chos can bkag pas ma yin no //üîΩthams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi ngo po rang rig pa tsam du rnam par gnas te ji skad du brjod pa gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa brjod par bya ste chos can bkag pas ma yin no // thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Therefore, it exists just as the nature of self-awareness, as has been said. Because it is free from the duality of object and subject, it should be said to be non-dual, not because the possessor of attributes is negated.üîΩIt does not follow that everyone is liberated because they see reality.

original: de nyid gzung ba yang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba yang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba ste /

analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sa bon dang ldan pas de bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan dag ni de lta bur gyur pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid du khas @171b mi len pa rnam par shes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de lta bur gyur pa yang chos kyi de kho na nyid du khas @171b mi len pa rnam par shes pa ni dngos po 'dzin pa spangs pa yin te /

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi lam la brten pa zhes so //

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //

analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang skye ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam mo //

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe sdang gi rigs bskyed pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Space, and so on.

original: dper na nam mkha' thogs par byed pa'i rdzas dang bral ba tsam sna tshogs pa med pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yang bum pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa'i sgras so sor snang ba bzhin nye bar bstan te /

analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i phyir rin chen 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams kyi dngos po med pa ste /

analyzed: rtog pa thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir /

translated: the bodhicitta of AmitƒÅbha is stated:

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ye shes ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //

translated: it is with regard to those that exist as not produced by reality, because AmitƒÅbha, etc., are not able to withstand analysis in terms of the characteristics of objects.

analyzed: ngo bo med ces bya ba ni snang ba mtha' yas la sogs par yod pa med pa'o//
translated: They are without essence means that they do not exist as AmitƒÅbha, etc.

analyzed: sgom pa yang med ces bya ba ni chos rjes su 'jug pa'i sems kyang med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no meditation means that there is no mind that engages with phenomena.üîΩWell then, how is AmitƒÅbha generated?

original: 'o na ji ltar snang pa mtha' yas bskyed pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar snang pa mtha' yas bskyed pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po med pa yang nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is also a nonentity.

original: ji ltar gnas te sgra dang @172b lhan cig tu 'brel par rtogs pa yin la de bzhin du de rnams kyang bskyed pa de kho na nyid ma yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas te sgra dang @172b lhan cig tu 'brel par rtogs pa yin la de bzhin du de rnams kyang bskyed pa de kho na nyid ma yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: How do they abide? They are understood to be connected with sound, and in the same way, they should be understood to be generated as the reality of Amoghasiddhi.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa ni /
translated: The one who conquers all tathƒÅgatas is Amoghasiddhi.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad dmigs su med pa ste bya ba grub pa'i ye shes te sangs rgyas kyi ming yang sgrib pa yin zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //

translated: All mental factors are unapprehendable, which is the gnosis of successful activity. Even the name ‚Äúbuddha‚Äù is a hindrance, as the words say.

analyzed: rang bzhin ni ngo bos dmigs su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The nature is the nature of gnosis, which is unapprehendable by nature. Because it is the essence of appearance, it is clear light.

analyzed: don yod grub pa la sogs pa chos kyi ngo bo nyid de rgyu gsungs pa /

original: gdod nas dag pa ste /
analyzed: gdod nas dag pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The secret of the body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent lords is the transcendent lord Vajradhara.

analyzed: de'i chos ni phung @173a * //
translated: Its phenomena are the aggregates.üîΩ

original: mtshan ma dang / bskyed pa dang / 'byin pa'i sngags la sogs pa nges par bstan pa las gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yang 'dir go rims bzhin du me long dang / pi wang dang / dri'i dud dang / ro'i snod dang / gos sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / bskyed pa dang / 'byin pa'i sngags la sogs pa nges par bstan pa las gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yang 'dir go rims bzhin du me long dang / pi wang dang / dri'i dud dang / ro'i snod dang / gos sna tshogs dang /
translated: The signs, the generation, the mantra for ejecting, and so on are taught. The forms of Vajraratna and so on are the mirror, the lute, the perfume conch, the food plate, the various garments, and the Dharma source.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma ste /
